description: From Latin tridēns, from three (“three”) +‎ dēns (“tooth”).

entries.meaning: A three-pronged spear somewhat resembling a pitchfork.
(geometry) A curve of third order of the form:
examples:
x
        y
        +
        a
        
          x
          
            3
          
        
        +
        b
        
          x
          
            2
          
        
        +
        c
        x
        =
        d
        
      
    
    {\displaystyle xy+ax^{3}+bx^{2}+cx=d\,}
